intro: Trichinium subfuscum, commonly known as the dark false nettle, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes many stinging plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and alternate leaves with serrated edges. It produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters. Trichinium subfuscum is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
